intro: Critesion iranicum, commonly known as the Iranian thistle, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant features spiny leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its botanical significance lies in its traditional use in herbal medicine and its role in local ecosystems.
